Key Match Events: Arshdeep Singh bowled two back-to-back yorkers to Fred Klaassen and Logan van Beek
Arshdeep Singh got a hat-trick chance but missed it
Arshdeep Singh bowled a superb bouncer to dismiss Logan van Beek
Arshdeep Singh dug in short from around the stumps to pull to deep square
Arshdeep Singh bowled a ripper of a yorker to floor Shariz Ahmad
Arshdeep Singh bowled a yorker-length delivery to tailing into middle and squirted down to mid-on
Pre-Game Insights: India captain Rohit Sharma: When you're expected to win, the pressure is a lot more.
Netherlands captain Scott Edwards: Definitely the noisiest crowd I've played in front of.
Suryakumar Yadav is Player of the Match for his 25-ball 51*
Suryakumar Yadav made his name with his end-overs yorkers
Arshdeep Singh has shown he has other weapons too, including new-ball swing and a mean bouncer
Post-Match Reflections: India captain Rohit Sharma: I'm not entirely happy with the way I batted, wouldn't say it was a perfect knock.
India captain Rohit Sharma: Just to get some runs under my belt was good.
Netherlands captain Scott Edwards: It was always going to be tricky chasing 180.
Netherlands captain Scott Edwards: Thought we bowled reasonably well, if you don't get wickets, with the batting order they've got, would've been tough to restrict.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India's bowlers were also clinical in their defence of 180 against Netherlands
India's top order batted well, with Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, and Suryakumar Yadav scoring 53, 62*, and 51* respectively
Netherlands were bowled out for 123 in 20 overs, with Bhuvneshwar Kumar taking 2/9 in 3 overs and Arshdeep Singh taking 2/23 in 3 overs
